titles.title: Staten Island Aircraft Noise Correction Act of 1999
To require the Federal Aviation Administration to address the aircraft noise problems of Staten Island, New York.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 2/23/1999--Introduced. Staten Island Aircraft Noise Correction Act of 1999 - Declares that the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) should remedy the problem it has created by formulating and implementing plans to mitigate aircraft noise over certain areas of Staten Island, New York. Directs the FAA Administrator to develop and publish a plan to investigate and test a straight-out southbound departure procedure from Runway 22 of Newark International Airport. Confers standing in U.S. district court upon any Staten Island resident to compel the FAA Administrator to comply with this Act.
